page.title: 17QUEENS ARMS PUB
page.content: Originally the Queens Arms was a coaching Inn.It was the first stop on the journey from Macclesfield to London.The building has changed a lot from the original althrough there is still an oak beam above the bar which probably came from an old sailing ship.The present building has one bar and a main room.There is a smaller room used for people who want to eat the a,la carte food.A pint of beer costs 66p and a pint of Guinness costs 86p .The beer is brewed by Boddingtons at Strangeways breweries in Manchester.The beer is kepted in a cellar in barrels at 50 degrees F.The publicans keep a toad in the cellar to kill beeltes.The pub is open every day at lunchtime and evenings.
